extracted_information: This document outlines the recent evolution of the Hyperliquid SDK (nktkas/hyperliquid) through its release history, detailing new features, bug fixes, and breaking changes. The updates reflect continuous improvements in exchange and info functionalities, WebSocket transport reliability, and signing capabilities, alongside refactoring and dependency management.

bug_fixes: fix(subscription): correct parameter order in `l2Book` and `userFills` payloads
other_changes: docs(readme): update polyfills for react native

features: feat(exchange): add `expiresAfter` for all L1 actions
breaking_changes: refactor(exchange)!: changes args in methods `createVault` and `twapOrder`
refactor(exchange)!: separate action arguments from execution modifiers
refactor(signing)!: remove support for `window.ethereum` as a wallet
refactor(exchange)!: change in args of method `perpDeploy`
refactor(transport)!: errors in `request`, `subscribe`, and `unsubscribe` calls are wrapped in a `TransportError` error class

features: feat: add support for private keys as abstract wallet
bug_fixes: fix(exchange): fix parameter for `convertToMultiSigUser` to work with null
other_changes: build: update minimal nodejs version to >= 24

bug_fixes: fix(multisign): improve work in `approveAgent` with empty `agentName`
fix(multisign): improve external work with signers type

features: Add `actionSorter` with functions and `userSignedActionEip712Types` for correct signature generation in `signL1Action` and `signUserSignedAction`
breaking_changes: In `InfoClient`, return values in the `blockDetails`, `txDetails`, and `userDetails` methods have been changed
other_changes: This release implements the MultiSign client and adds support utilities for signature generation.

bug_fixes: `WebSocketTransport` now does not send a request from the buffer (used when reconnecting) if the request is aborted
Correct handling of duplicate async requests via `WebSocketTransport`
Correct handling of errors related to subscription requests
breaking_changes: `AbortSignal` is removed from all subscription requests
Renaming client classes: `EventClient` to `SubscriptionClient`, `PublicClient` to `InfoClient`, `WalletClient` to `ExchangeClient`
other_changes: This release includes improvements to `WebSocketTransport` and the SDK interface.

features: Convert jsr import “@noble/hashes” to npm version
breaking_changes: `MessageBufferStrategy` in `ReconnectingWebSocket` should now be iterable + `push` method
Property `originalError` in `ReconnectingWebSocketError` has been renamed to `cause`
Keep alive logic in `WebSocketTransport` now waits for a pong response and sends ping only when necessary

features: Updated API for EventClient: add `allMids` parameters
SDK: add overloads for methods of classes with optional parameters (EventClient: `allMids`, PublicClient: `allMids`, `meta`, WalletClient: `scheduleCancel`, `spotDeploy`, `perpDeploy`)
bug_fixes: enhance chain ID guessing to support extended Viem wallet clients
